taskbody.context: This is a general case of the reintegrate method. You can consider the following example: calculate the changes necessary to get (from) the HEAD revision of the trunk (to) the HEAD revision of the branch, and apply those changes to my working copy (of the trunk). The result is that trunk will be identical with the branch.If the server does not support merge-tracking then this is the only way to merge a branch back to trunk.

step.stepresult: The Merge wizard is opened: The Merge Wizard - The Merge Type

step.cmd: Select the option Merge two different trees.

step.stepresult: The second step of the Merge wizard is displayed: The Merge Wizard - Merge Two Different Trees

step.cmd: Specify the URL of the first tree in the From field.

info.p: If you are using this method to merge a feature branch back to trunk, you need to start the merge wizard from within a working copy of trunk. In the From field enter the full folder URL of the trunk. This may sound wrong, but remember that the trunk is the start point to which you want to add the branch changes. In the To field enter the full folder URL of the feature branch.
By default the start URL will be the URL of the selected file in the working copy. If you want to specify a different URL you should browse the repository and select a start URL and a revision.

substep.cmd: Select a URL in the From field.
Select a revision of the repository from the From field.

info.p: In the Revision field enter the last revision number at which the two trees were synchronized. If you are sure no-one else is making commits you can use the HEAD revision in both cases. If there is a chance that someone else may have made a commit since that synchronization, use the specific revision number to avoid losing more recent commits.
By default the HEAD revision is selected. If you want a previous revision you have to select the Other revision option and press the History button to see a list of all revisions.

step.cmd: Specify the URL of the second tree in the To field.

substep.cmd: Select a URL in the To field.
Select a revision of the repository from the To field.
substep.info: By default the HEAD revision is selected. If you want a previous revision you have to select the Other revision option and press the History button to see a list of all revisions.

step.cmd: Specify the target of the merge operation in the Target panel.
step.info: The Target panel of the dialog reminds you the location of the target resource from the working copy where the merge result will be saved and its corresponding repository URL.

substep.cmd: Specify the working copy path in the Working copy field.
Specify the repository URL corresponding to the working copy.
